column19: date=22 March 2020}}</ref> Another two new cases of coronavirus were confirmed that same day, a 50-year-old woman from the village Vrapçiç of [[Gjilan]] and a 53-year-old man from the village Domanek of [[Mališevo]] tested positive for coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column21: title=Konfirmohet edhe dy raste të reja me Coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 33 numri i të infektuarve
column22: trans-title=Two new cases with Coronavirus in Kosovo are confirmed, the number of infected reaches 33

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''23 March''', two new cases of coronavirus were confirmed, a 44-year-old man from village Petrovo of [[Štimlje]], marking the first case for this municipality and a 39-year-old woman from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] was tested positive with coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Shkon në 35 numri i të prekurve nga koronavirusi në Kosovë – konfirmohen dy raste të reja
column4: trans-title=Number of people infected with coronavirus reaches 35 in Kosovo – two new cases confirmed
column7: date=23 March 2020}}</ref> Meanwhile, in the evening unfortunately even 26 cases were confirmed, 14 cases from [[Mališevo]], 11 close members of the same family from village Vrapčič of [[Gjilan]], 10 members of the same family got infected from another member who flew from [[Germany]]<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Haziri e quan lajm të keq infektimin e 11 anëtarëve të familjes Shaqiri me coronavirus
column10: trans-title=Haziri calls bad news the infecting of the 11 Shaqiri family members with coronavirus
column13: date=23 March 2020}}</ref> and one case from municipality of [[Gjakova]] and the number of positive cases rose to 61.<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=26 raste të reja me koronavirus në Kosovë, 61 të prekur gjithsej
column16: trans-title=26 new cases with coronavirus in Kosovo, 61 affected in total

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''24 March''', the decision taken one day before from [[Government of Kosovo]] for stopping the movement of people and vehicles for the following days came into force, the decision provides stopping the movement, except emergency cases from 10:00–16:00 and 20:00–06:00.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Prej nesër pritet të kufizohet lëvizja e lirë e qytetarëve dhe automjeteve
column4: trans-title=From tomorrow it is expected to restrict the free movement of citizens and vehicles
column7: date=23 March 2020}}</ref> While in the evening, two new cases of coronavirus were confirmed, a 25-year-old woman from the village Vrapčič of [[Gjilan]] and a 73-year-old woman from village Studime e Ulët of [[Vučitrn]], who had come days before from [[Norway]],<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=73-vjeçarja nga Vushtrria dyshohet se u infektua me koronavirus nga djali i saj në Norvegji
column10: trans-title=73-year-old from Vushtrri allegedly infected with coronavirus by her son in Norway
column13: date=24 March 2020}}</ref> marking the first case for this municipality was tested positive with coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=Edhe dy të infektuar, shkon në 63 numri i të prekurve me COVID-19 në Kosovë
column16: trans-title=Two more people are infected with COVID-19 in Kosovo

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''25 March''', eight new cases of coronavirus were confirmed, four cases were confirmed from the village Domanek of [[Mališevo]], three cases from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] and one case from village Studime e Ulët of [[Vučitrn]]. All cases was as a result of contact with people that tested positive days before on these villages and municipalities and the number of infected people rose to 71.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Edhe 8 raste të reja me koronavirus në Kosovë — 71 të prekur gjithsej
column4: trans-title=Another 8 new cases with coronavirus in Kosovo — 71 affected in total

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''26 March''' is marked the first recovery case, the son of the first victim of coronavirus resulted negative in the second test.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Zyrtare: Shërohet pacienti i parë me koronavirus në Kosovë
column4: trans-title=Official: The first patient with coronavirus in Kosovo is cured
column7: date=26 March 2020}}</ref> A few minutes later, four cases were confirmed from the village Studime e Ulët of [[Vučitrn]], three cases from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] and one case from village Llugaxhi of [[Peć]] was tested positive with coronavirus,<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=E infektuara me koronavirus nga Peja, ishte kontrolluar dje në Klinë
column10: trans-title=Infected with coronavirus from Peć, it was checked yesterday in Klina
column13: date=26 March 2020}}</ref> but the night of same day comes to an end with seven new cases from [[Mališevo]] was tested positive with coronavirus and the number of infected people rose to 86.<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=Shkon në 86 numri i të prekurve me koronavirus në Kosovë
column16: trans-title=The number of people infected with coronavirus in Kosovo reaches 86

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''27 March''', two new cases of coronavirus are confirmed in the evening, one from [[Gjakova]] and the other from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] and the number of positive cases rose to 88.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Konfirmohen edhe dy raste pozitive me coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 88 numri i të infektuarve
column4: trans-title=Two more positive cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Kosovo, bringing the number of infected to 88

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''28 March''', two new cases of coronavirus are confirmed, one from [[Podujevo]] and the other from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]].<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Dy raste të reja me coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 90 numri i të infektuarve
column4: trans-title=Two new cases with coronavirus in Kosovo, the number of infected goes to 90
column7: date=28 March 2020}}</ref> Another one new case of coronavirus were confirmed that same day again in Pristina,<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Konfirmohet edhe një rast me Covid-19 në Kosovë, rritet numri në 91 të infektuar
column10: trans-title=Another case with Covid-19 in Kosovo is confirmed, the number increases to 91 infected
column13: date=28 March 2020}}</ref> and all cases was contact cases.

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''29 March''', two new cases of coronavirus are confirmed, two from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] and one from the village Kijevo of [[Mališevo]] and the number of positive cases rose to 94.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Edhe tri raste të reja me coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 94 numri i të prekurve

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''30 March''', 12 new cases of coronavirus are confirmed, five from [[Mališevo]], three from [[Kosovo Polje]], two from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]], one from [[Mitrovica, Kosovo
date=March 2014}}: Mitrovica]] (later confirmed as case from [[North Mitrovica]])<ref>{{cite news

column9: date=30 March 2020}}</ref> and one from [[Kamenica, Kosovo
column10: Kamenica]] and the number of positive cases rose to 106.<ref>{{cite news
column12: title=12 raste të reja me coronavirus, shkon në 106 numri i të infektuarve në Kosovë
column13: trans-title=12 new cases with coronavirus, goes to 106 the number of infected in Kosovo

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''31 March''', two new cases of coronavirus are confirmed, one as a case of contact of two positive relatives with coronavirus from [[Gjakova]] and one from [[Prizren]], who was infected during a visit abroad.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Dy raste të reja me coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 108 numri i të prekurve
column4: trans-title=Two new cases with coronavirus in Kosovo, goes to 108 the number of those affected
column7: date=31 March 2020}}</ref> On that day confirmed that five cases with coronavirus have been cured and four other cases have been infected, infected are two from [[North Mitrovica]], one from [[Vučitrn]] and one from [[Mališevo]].<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=IKSHPK: Pesë pacientë të shëruar nga coronavirusi, katër të tjerë të infektuar, arrin në 112 numri i të prekurve me COVID-19 në Kosovë
column10: trans-title=NIPHK: Five patients cured of coronavirus, four others infected, reaches 112 the number of those affected by COVID-19 in Kosovo

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''1 April''', four cases with coronavirus have been cured and 13 other cases have been infected, infected are 11 from the village [[Topanicë]] of [[Mališevo]], one from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] and one from [[Gjakova]].<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=10 pacientë të shëruar nga COVID-19, sot 13 raste të reja me virus, shkon në 125 numri i të infektuarve në Kosovë
column4: trans-title=10 patients cured by COVID-19, today 13 new cases with virus, goes to 125 the number of infected in Kosovo

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''2 April''', a new case was confirmed. A woman from the village [[Koriša]] of [[Prizren]] tested positive for coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Konfirmohet edhe një rast me COVID-19 – shkon në 126 numri i të infektuarve në Kosovë

column7: date=2 April 2020}}</ref> The Ministry of Health decided to quarantine and block the entrances in the village.<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Korisha futet në karantinë, Haskuka kërkon nga qytetarët të respektohen rekomandimet e IKSHPK-së
column10: trans-title=Korisha enters quarantine, Haskuka urges citizens to respect NIPHK recommendations

column7: date=3 April 2020}}</ref> and six other cases have been infected, infected are four case from village Llugaxhi of [[Peć]], one from Peć and one quarantined in the quarantine created in the Student Center in [[Pristina]].<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Edhe gjashtë raste me COVID-19, shkon në 132 numri i të infektuarve në Kosovë
column10: trans-title=Gjashtë raste të tjera me COVID-19, goes to 132 the number of infected in Kosovo

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''4 April''', two new cases of coronavirus are confirmed in [[North Mitrovica]]. On that day confirmed that seven cases with coronavirus have been cured and five other cases have been infected, infected are two from village [[Banja, Mališevo
date=March 2014}}: Banja]] of [[Mališevo]], one from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]], one from village Smrekonicë of [[Vučitrn]] and one quarantined in the quarantine created in the Student Center in Pristina.<ref>{{cite news

date=March 2014}}: Banja]] of [[Mališevo]], one from [[Gjakova]] and one from village Smrekonicë of [[Vučitrn]] and all cases was contact cases, increasing the number of positive issues to 145.<ref>{{cite news

column4: title=Shënohen edhe dy viktima nga coronavirusi, shkon në tre numri i të vdekurve në Kosovë

column10: title=20 raste të reja me coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 165 numri i të infektuarve

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''7 April''', five new cases are confirmed, five correctional officers and a health worker at the Detention Center in [[North Mitrovica]] were tested positive for coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news

column4: trans-title=Five correctional officers and a health worker affected by coronavirus

column9: title=65 vjeçari nga Ferizaj që vdiq nga arresti kardiak rezultoi pozitiv edhe në COVID-19

column13: date=7 April 2020}}</ref> Another three new cases of coronavirus were confirmed that same day, one in critical condition from Ferizaj, one from [[Mališevo]], one from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]], one from [[Gjilan]] and one [[laboratory technician]] from [[Gjakova]].<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=Edhe pesë raste të reja me coronavirus, shkon në 170 numri i të infektuarve
column16: trans-title=Five new cases with coronavirus, the number of infected goes to 170
column19: date=7 April 2020}}</ref> A few hours later, six cases with coronavirus have been cured and 19 other cases have been infected, infected are eight from village Smrekonicë of [[Vučitrn]], three from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]], two village Senik of [[Mališevo]] and with one cases from village [[Llashkadrenoc]] of Mališevo, village Sazli of Ferizaj, village Ujmirë of [[Klina]], [[Gjakova]], [[Gjilan]] and village [[Topanicë]] of Mališevo.<ref>{{cite news
column21: title=Edhe 19 raste të reja, shkon në 184 numri i të infektuarve me coronavirus në Kosovë
column22: trans-title=Another 19 new cases, the number of people infected with coronavirus in Kosovo goes to 184

column3: title=Edhe një i prekur me coronavirus nga Malisheva – arrin në 22 numri me Covid-19

column7: date=20 March 2020}}</ref> Two additional cases of coronavirus were confirmed on the night of that date. A 53-year-old woman from [[Suva Reka]] and a 43-year-old man from [[Gjakova]] tested positive for coronavirus, both contacts of previously confirmed cases and the number of positive cases rose to 24.<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Edhe dy raste të konfirmuara me coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 24 numri i të prekurve me Covid-19
column10: trans-title=Two more confirmed cases of coronavirus in Kosovo, number reaches 24 with Covid-19

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''21 March''', four new cases of coronavirus were confirmed. A 32-year-old man from the village Bibaj of [[Ferizaj]], who had come from [[Germany]] tested positive for coronavirus, while three other cases are contact cases; three women aged 29 and 50 from [[Pristina]] and one aged 40 from [[Gjakova]].<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Edhe katër raste me coronavirus – shkon në 28 numri i të prekurve në Kosovë
column4: trans-title=Even four more cases with coronavirus – the number of those affected in Kosovo reaches 28
column7: date=21 March 2020}}</ref> Another two new cases of coronavirus were confirmed on the night of same day, a 20-year-old man and a 36-year-old woman from [[Gjilan]] had been tested positive for coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Konfirmohen edhe dy raste me coronavirus në Kosovë, arrin në 30 numri i të infektuarve
column10: trans-title=Even two more cases with coronavirus are confirmed in Kosovo, the number of infected reaches 30

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: In the early hours of '''22 March''', a new case was confirmed. A 31-year-old man from the village Senik of [[Mališevo]] tested positive for coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Rritet në 31 numri i të prekurve me coronavirus në Kosovë
column4: trans-title=The number of coronavirus infected people increases to 31 in Kosovo
column7: date=22 March 2020}}</ref> On the same day the first death from coronavirus was confirmed. An 82-year-old man from village Dumnica of [[Podujevo]] is the first victim from the pandemic, he had contracted the virus through contact with his son and daughter. Prior to the infection, the victim suffered from cardiac and chronic lung disease and on the sixth day of the infection he had signs of pulmonary infiltration and massive pneumonia on the left side.<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Shënohet viktima e parë nga koronavirusi në Kosovë, vdiq një 82-vjeçar nga Dumnica
column10: trans-title=The first coronavirus victim in Kosovo marked, an 82-year-old from Dumnica died
column15: title=Konfirmon IKSHPK: Shënohet viktima e parë nga coronavirusi në Kosovë
column16: trans-title=NIPHK confirmed: The first coronavirus victim in Kosovo is marked
column19: date=22 March 2020}}</ref> Another two new cases of coronavirus were confirmed that same day, a 50-year-old woman from the village Vrapçiç of [[Gjilan]] and a 53-year-old man from the village Domanek of [[Mališevo]] tested positive for coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column21: title=Konfirmohet edhe dy raste të reja me Coronavirus në Kosovë, shkon në 33 numri i të infektuarve
column22: trans-title=Two new cases with Coronavirus in Kosovo are confirmed, the number of infected reaches 33

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''23 March''', two new cases of coronavirus were confirmed, a 44-year-old man from village Petrovo of [[Štimlje]], marking the first case for this municipality and a 39-year-old woman from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] was tested positive with coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Shkon në 35 numri i të prekurve nga koronavirusi në Kosovë – konfirmohen dy raste të reja
column4: trans-title=Number of people infected with coronavirus reaches 35 in Kosovo – two new cases confirmed
column7: date=23 March 2020}}</ref> Meanwhile, in the evening unfortunately even 26 cases were confirmed, 14 cases from [[Mališevo]], 11 close members of the same family from village Vrapčič of [[Gjilan]], 10 members of the same family got infected from another member who flew from [[Germany]]<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=Haziri e quan lajm të keq infektimin e 11 anëtarëve të familjes Shaqiri me coronavirus
column10: trans-title=Haziri calls bad news the infecting of the 11 Shaqiri family members with coronavirus
column13: date=23 March 2020}}</ref> and one case from municipality of [[Gjakova]] and the number of positive cases rose to 61.<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=26 raste të reja me koronavirus në Kosovë, 61 të prekur gjithsej
column16: trans-title=26 new cases with coronavirus in Kosovo, 61 affected in total

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''24 March''', the decision taken one day before from [[Government of Kosovo]] for stopping the movement of people and vehicles for the following days came into force, the decision provides stopping the movement, except emergency cases from 10:00–16:00 and 20:00–06:00.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Prej nesër pritet të kufizohet lëvizja e lirë e qytetarëve dhe automjeteve
column4: trans-title=From tomorrow it is expected to restrict the free movement of citizens and vehicles
column7: date=23 March 2020}}</ref> While in the evening, two new cases of coronavirus were confirmed, a 25-year-old woman from the village Vrapčič of [[Gjilan]] and a 73-year-old woman from village Studime e Ulët of [[Vučitrn]], who had come days before from [[Norway]],<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=73-vjeçarja nga Vushtrria dyshohet se u infektua me koronavirus nga djali i saj në Norvegji
column10: trans-title=73-year-old from Vushtrri allegedly infected with coronavirus by her son in Norway
column13: date=24 March 2020}}</ref> marking the first case for this municipality was tested positive with coronavirus.<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=Edhe dy të infektuar, shkon në 63 numri i të prekurve me COVID-19 në Kosovë
column16: trans-title=Two more people are infected with COVID-19 in Kosovo

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: On '''25 March''', eight new cases of coronavirus were confirmed, four cases were confirmed from the village Domanek of [[Mališevo]], three cases from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] and one case from village Studime e Ulët of [[Vučitrn]]. All cases was as a result of contact with people that tested positive days before on these villages and municipalities and the number of infected people rose to 71.<ref>{{cite news
column3: title=Edhe 8 raste të reja me koronavirus në Kosovë — 71 të prekur gjithsej
column4: trans-title=Another 8 new cases with coronavirus in Kosovo — 71 affected in total

column4: trans-title=Official: The first patient with coronavirus in Kosovo is cured
column7: date=26 March 2020}}</ref> A few minutes later, four cases were confirmed from the village Studime e Ulët of [[Vučitrn]], three cases from Kosovo's capital, [[Pristina]] and one case from village Llugaxhi of [[Peć]] was tested positive with coronavirus,<ref>{{cite news
column9: title=E infektuara me koronavirus nga Peja, ishte kontrolluar dje në Klinë
column10: trans-title=Infected with coronavirus from Peć, it was checked yesterday in Klina
column13: date=26 March 2020}}</ref> but the night of same day comes to an end with seven new cases from [[Mališevo]] was tested positive with coronavirus and the number of infected people rose to 86.<ref>{{cite news
column15: title=Shkon në 86 numri i të prekurve me koronavirus në Kosovë

Caption         = Tame Impala performing at the [[Music Hall of Williamsburg]] in [[New York City

Alt             = Three members of a rock band performing. To the left a man performs on a black-and-white electric guitar and sings into a microphone; behind him another man performs on a drum kit. To the right a man performs on a keyboard instrument, with a microphone visible in front of him. The band perform against violet-coloured lights.

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: The discography of [[Tame Impala]], a [[psychedelic rock]] project by the Australian musician [[Kevin Parker (musician)
date=March 2014}}: Kevin Parker]], consists of four [[studio album]]s, two [[live albums]], three [[extended play]]s, eighteen [[Single (music)
column3: single]]s and several collaborations and compilation appearances.

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: Tame Impala were formed in [[Perth]] in 2007 after Parker's home recordings on [[Myspace]] drew attention from the [[independent record label]] [[Modular Recordings]]. The band signed to Modular among a [[Bid price
date=March 2014}}: bidding war]] and the band's eponymous debut EP was released in September 2008 to national acclaim;<ref>{{cite web
column13: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> it topped the [[Australian Independent Record Labels Association
column14: Australian Independent Record Labels Chart]] and peaked at number 10 on the [[ARIA Charts
column22: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> as well as receiving widespread positive reviews and leading the band to appear on [[Triple J]]{{'}}s [[Triple J Hottest 100
column23: Hottest 100]] list at the end of the year.<ref>{{cite web
column25: title=Kings of Leon top Triple J's Hottest 100
column30: accessdate=9 January 2015}} {{subscription required}}</ref> Tame Impala's debut studio album, ''[[Innerspeaker]]'', was released in May 2010 and received international acclaim,<ref>{{cite web
column45: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> as well as peaking at number 4 on the [[ARIA Charts
column46: Australian Albums Chart]] and placing in the national charts in Belgium, the Netherlands and the United Kingdom. ''Innerspeaker'' was subsequently nominated for three [[ARIA Music Awards
column47: Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA) Music Awards]],<ref>{{cite web
column54: archivedate=20 January 2012}} NB User can either select \"Panel view\" or \"List view\" from the header menu. To see nomination information in \"Panel view\", user must hover over the applicable award to see other nominees.</ref> certified Gold by the ARIA and won the best-album accolade at both the [[Rolling Stone Australia Awards
column55: ''Rolling Stone'' Awards]] and [[J Award]]s in 2011.<ref name=\"smh\">{{cite web
column57: title=Tame Impala win at Rolling Stone Awards
column59: publisher=[[Fairfax Media]]
column61: date=17 January 2013
column64: title=Tame Impala wins J Award | music news

date=March 2014}}: Lonerism]]'', Tame Impala's second studio album, was released in October 2012. The album received \"universal acclaim\" according to [[Metacritic]],<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Reviews for Lonerism by Tame Impala
column6: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> and placed in the top 40 in Australia, Belgium, Ireland, New Zealand, the UK and the United States. The album's three supporting singles—\"[[Elephant (Tame Impala song)
column7: Elephant]]\", \"[[Feels Like We Only Go Backwards]]\" and \"Mind Mischief\"—were moderate successes, particularly in the US where \"Elephant\" peaked at number 8 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)
column8: Billboard]]'' [[Alternative Songs]] chart. ''Lonerism'' was voted number one on several publications' year-end album lists, including ''[[NME]]'',<ref>{{cite web
column19: title=Albums of the year: 01 Tame Impala – Lonerism
column31: title=News | FILTER's Top 10 of 2012: Staff Picks
column36: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> Like ''Innerspeaker'', ''Lonerism'' received best-album accolade at the ''Rolling Stone'' and J Awards;<ref name=\"smh\" /> the album has since been certified Gold in Australia and Silver in the UK. It also garnered a [[Grammy Award]] nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Alternative Music Album
column37: Best Alternative Music Album]] at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite press release
column45: title=Nominations for the 56th Annual Grammy Awards®
column49: agency=[[National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences

date=March 2014}}: Image           = Tame Impala Performing in NYC.jpg
Caption         = Tame Impala performing at the [[Music Hall of Williamsburg]] in [[New York City

Alt             = Three members of a rock band performing. To the left a man performs on a black-and-white electric guitar and sings into a microphone; behind him another man performs on a drum kit. To the right a man performs on a keyboard instrument, with a microphone visible in front of him. The band perform against violet-coloured lights.

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: The discography of [[Tame Impala]], a [[psychedelic rock]] project by the Australian musician [[Kevin Parker (musician)
date=March 2014}}: Kevin Parker]], consists of four [[studio album]]s, two [[live albums]], three [[extended play]]s, eighteen [[Single (music)
column3: single]]s and several collaborations and compilation appearances.

→‎Venus flyby,safe,CRS-20,"{{Use America: Tame Impala were formed in [[Perth]] in 2007 after Parker's home recordings on [[Myspace]] drew attention from the [[independent record label]] [[Modular Recordings]]. The band signed to Modular among a [[Bid price
date=March 2014}}: bidding war]] and the band's eponymous debut EP was released in September 2008 to national acclaim;<ref>{{cite web
column13: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> it topped the [[Australian Independent Record Labels Association
column14: Australian Independent Record Labels Chart]] and peaked at number 10 on the [[ARIA Charts
column22: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> as well as receiving widespread positive reviews and leading the band to appear on [[Triple J]]{{'}}s [[Triple J Hottest 100
column23: Hottest 100]] list at the end of the year.<ref>{{cite web
column25: title=Kings of Leon top Triple J's Hottest 100
column30: accessdate=9 January 2015}} {{subscription required}}</ref> Tame Impala's debut studio album, ''[[Innerspeaker]]'', was released in May 2010 and received international acclaim,<ref>{{cite web
column45: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> as well as peaking at number 4 on the [[ARIA Charts
column46: Australian Albums Chart]] and placing in the national charts in Belgium, the Netherlands and the United Kingdom. ''Innerspeaker'' was subsequently nominated for three [[ARIA Music Awards
column47: Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA) Music Awards]],<ref>{{cite web
column54: archivedate=20 January 2012}} NB User can either select \"Panel view\" or \"List view\" from the header menu. To see nomination information in \"Panel view\", user must hover over the applicable award to see other nominees.</ref> certified Gold by the ARIA and won the best-album accolade at both the [[Rolling Stone Australia Awards
column55: ''Rolling Stone'' Awards]] and [[J Award]]s in 2011.<ref name=\"smh\">{{cite web
column57: title=Tame Impala win at Rolling Stone Awards
column59: publisher=[[Fairfax Media]]
column61: date=17 January 2013
column64: title=Tame Impala wins J Award | music news

date=March 2014}}: Lonerism]]'', Tame Impala's second studio album, was released in October 2012. The album received \"universal acclaim\" according to [[Metacritic]],<ref>{{cite web
column4: title=Reviews for Lonerism by Tame Impala
column6: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> and placed in the top 40 in Australia, Belgium, Ireland, New Zealand, the UK and the United States. The album's three supporting singles—\"[[Elephant (Tame Impala song)
column7: Elephant]]\", \"[[Feels Like We Only Go Backwards]]\" and \"Mind Mischief\"—were moderate successes, particularly in the US where \"Elephant\" peaked at number 8 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)
column8: Billboard]]'' [[Alternative Songs]] chart. ''Lonerism'' was voted number one on several publications' year-end album lists, including ''[[NME]]'',<ref>{{cite web
column19: title=Albums of the year: 01 Tame Impala – Lonerism
column31: title=News | FILTER's Top 10 of 2012: Staff Picks
column36: accessdate=9 January 2015}}</ref> Like ''Innerspeaker'', ''Lonerism'' received best-album accolade at the ''Rolling Stone'' and J Awards;<ref name=\"smh\" /> the album has since been certified Gold in Australia and Silver in the UK. It also garnered a [[Grammy Award]] nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Alternative Music Album
column37: Best Alternative Music Album]] at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite press release
column45: title=Nominations for the 56th Annual Grammy Awards®
column49: agency=[[National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences
